result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan J Juel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

2 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

Probation can end after 12 months if agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan J Juel

records.addlTxt: Ck# 44287 mailed to defendant; remainder of cash posted

10:08 AM Defendant Susan J Juel in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement.
Defendant waives right for the Judge to appear in person freely, voluntarily and knowingly. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 
18 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions (Probation can terminate after 12 months if agent deems appropriate and files paperwork)
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with recommendations
court costs and surcharges.

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 2 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation.

10:02 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Susan J Juel in court without counsel. 
Defendant waives their right to an attorney and court accepts waiver.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Second Amended Complaint
adding Count 3- Misdemeanor Bail Jumping

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.

(11:14 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Susan J Juel in court without counsel.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 18, 2022 at 3 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
